title: UNLIMEAT: "It’s the Perfect Time to Enhance the ‘Deliciousness’ of Alternative Meat" - vegconomist - the vegan business magazine
summary: UNLIMEAT, a South Korean company with a US presence, produces plant-based meat, seafood, and other foods using upcycled materials to reduce food waste. They strive to create delicious and convenient plant-based options by focusing on K-vegan concepts and incorporating upcycled ingredients like rice bran and soybean meal. UNLIMEAT is expanding its reach through retail channels, food service, and e-commerce while collaborating with other brands to create innovative plant-based products.
product_or_process: plant-based meat, seafood, dairy products, frozen kimbap, rice balls, and other upcycled food products
likely_naics_codes: ['311111 - Animal (except poultry) slaughtering and processing', '311421 - Meat packing plants', '311999 - Other food manufacturing, n.e.c.', '445110 - Supermarkets and other grocery (except convenience) stores']
greenwashing: The article does not provide any evidence suggesting UNLIMEAT is engaging in greenwashing.

title: Fresh Thyme Market Reveals Inaugural Top Ten Food Trends for 2024 - PR Newswire
summary: Fresh Thyme Market, a grocery chain focused on fresh and healthy foods, has released its first trends report highlighting upcoming consumer preferences in the Midwest. The report includes insights from SPINS Research, indicating emerging trends in various grocery categories. Fresh Thyme Market aims to provide communities with real, fresh, and honest products while focusing on local preferences and sourcing.

title: The plastipelago - New Mandala
summary: Indonesia faces a severe waste crisis, with plastic pollution being a significant concern. The government has adopted a circular economy model through the Indonesia Clean from Waste (ICFW) policy, aiming to reduce waste and promote recycling. However, the policy's reliance on waste banks and its exclusion of informal waste workers raises concerns about its effectiveness and potential for social injustice.
likely_naics_codes: ['562111 - Waste Collection', '562112 - Waste Treatment and Disposal', '325999 - All Other Miscellaneous Manufacturing', '237110 - Heavy and Civil Engineering Construction']
greenwashing: The article suggests that the incorporation of plastic waste into road tar, while seemingly beneficial, could be used to justify delaying a nationwide ban on single-use plastics, potentially indicating a form of greenwashing.

title: The Employer-Educator Partnership That Can Fill U.S. Jobs - HBR.org Daily
summary: Harvard Business Review (HBR) Learning offers an online leadership training course called 'Attracting and Cultivating Talent.' This course focuses on helping individuals develop skills to attract, hire, develop, and retain talented employees. The course is accessible through HBR Learning's online platform and includes various modules designed to guide participants through the employee journey.

title: Brushes with purpose: Kohl Kreatives eyes growth potential among India's eco-conscious beauty consumers - CosmeticsDesign-Asia.com
summary: Kohl Kreatives, a makeup tools brand, has launched in India, offering sustainable and inclusive products. The brand emphasizes the use of upcycled materials and acknowledges the higher cost associated with sustainable practices. Kohl Kreatives believes in a global consumer base and plans to host more physical pop-up events in India to connect with customers.
